resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: William-Adolphe Bouguereau (1825–1905) was a French academic painter. As a salon painter, his work focused on classical subjects, with a particular interest for mythological and religious themes, and the woman body. Bouguereau was a fairly popular painter during his time, despite being criticized by artists such as the Impressionists, or art critics like Émile Zola who described his paintings as superficial. He fell out of favor at the beginning of the twentieth century, mainly due to the artistic innovations and changing tastes of the time. His studio was located in a house built for the artist by architect Jean-Louis Pascal in 1867, in the 6th arrondissement of Paris. Located on the top floor of the building, Bouguereau's studio had tall windows for the painter to be able to work with good lighting. Thought specially for Bouguereau, the studio was spacious, with room for the artist to work on large paintings with models and students. William-Adolphe Bouguereau, Self-portrait, 1879, oil on canvas (Canada, Montreal Museum of Fine Arts).
resource.chars:
William-Adolphe Bouguereau (1825–1905) was a French academic painter. As a salon painter, his work focused on classical subjects, with a particular interest for mythological and religious themes, and the woman body.

Bouguereau was a fairly popular painter during his time, despite being criticized by artists such as the Impressionists, or art critics like Émile Zola who described his paintings as superficial. He fell out of favor at the beginning of the twentieth century, mainly due to the artistic innovations and changing tastes of the time.

His studio was located in a house built for the artist by architect Jean-Louis Pascal in 1867, in the 6th arrondissement of Paris. Located on the top floor of the building, Bouguereau's studio had tall windows for the painter to be able to work with good lighting. Thought specially for Bouguereau, the studio was spacious, with room for the artist to work on large paintings with models and students.

William-Adolphe Bouguereau, Self-portrait, 1879, oil on canvas (Canada, Montreal Museum of Fine Arts).

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Sketch for Compassion, a painting Bouguereau exhibited during the 1897 Salon. Another picture of Bouguereau's atelier taken by Edmond Bénard shows the artist working on the aforementionned painting with a model.
resource.chars:
Sketch for Compassion, a painting Bouguereau exhibited during the 1897 Salon.

Another picture of Bouguereau's atelier taken by Edmond Bénard shows the artist working on the aforementionned painting with a model.
